alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 4:02PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Forsyth, northeastern Davidson, northwestern Randolph and western Guilford Counties through 430 PM EST... At 402 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winston-Salem to 7 miles southwest of Kernersville to near Thomasville. Movement was north at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, High Point, Thomasville, Kernersville, Archdale, Summerfield, Trinity, Stokesdale and Walkertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
